title.label: Best First Person RPG on the App Store

content.label: Great graphics, deep strategy, built in map making,  note taking, 16 save game slots. This is a hidden gem. I hope the developers get more publicity so they can continue making more great games.
So good makes me unsuicidal

I downloaded this game recently, and it's great.  7 Mages utilizes an older dungeon crawler system (turn-based combat/general movement), but also expanses upon that system with a modern aesthetic.  Definitely worth checking out.

title.label: It seemed like an ok game but

content.label: The dialogue was basically garbage and I couldn't see anything - no way to adjust the colors.  This is maybe an iPad game not good for iPhone

Looks like some are seeing bugs... none for me yet, and the gameplay gets better as you go.  If your not sure after you finish the crypt, beat the troll in the forest to the east and buy the swamp (NE forest).
Just bought the entire game and it has performed incredibly poorly--crashes continually with no save so you have to start over and over from the beginning.  Don't waste your money until it's fixed.
This game seems so cool but sadly it crashes during the tutorial every time so I can't play 😔

On the second fight,  the combat mode remains on while the defeated enemy has turned to coins. I approached from 3 diff angles, on 3 diff spaces, and the issue was consistent. Impossible to progress. 
iPhone 5

I did the free trial and liked it enough to buy the full game. It has a different style of player and game play than some others and it adds some cool and unique challenges vs the normal grinding games. A few of the puzzles were a bit difficult to figure out, but again, that gives some variety to the game. A few things could be improved, inventory management was cumbersome to drop multiple items after returning from a quest. Also, I wish there was more variety in the weapons and armor. I seem to have topped out on most items pretty early on, perhaps the nicer items could be more expensive later in the game. I ended with a bunch of money and nothing to spend it on.

The game is actually pretty fun but for the fact I purchased the full game for it to crash on me left and right I'm pretty upset. If it doesn't work out in a few days or whatever I'm going to get my money back for a game that does not work properly.

Couldn't even get through the tutorial I found it  so boring. Obviously it's me based on all the other reviews. Sure glad, though, they let you try it before buying it. Saved me from wasting $7. For that consideration I will keep an eye of this developer's future apps though. 

Really detailed graphics!
I LIKE THE STORY😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀

If you like old time dungeon crawlers, you don't get much more state of the art than this. Excellent graphics, top notch sound design, and inventive gameplay that actually lets you split up your party make this a unique game. 

Also, despite what some reviewers have said, it is NOT very difficult if you take the time to think about what you are doing and fully understand the spells and songs.

The songs are amazing. There are 5 instrument types in the game and as you play each different one it actually ads that instrument to the sound track. I have wasted hours just playing around with my band of mages. There are 15 or so songs as well and they sound great.

title.label: Good at first but turned bad

content.label: This game has beautiful graphics and plays pretty smooth but as another reviewer said the curve drops off like a rock, after the crypt it's almost impossible to level up because the only monsters you can verse are way too strong and you can't get more weapons because gold becomes scarce because of the lack of monsters, wish you guys could change this, this game had so much potential 😔

The game itself is ok, but the "turn based" fights are so bad. It can be your turn and the enemy will attack you or it will be the enemy's turn twice in a row giving you no chance to heal. That is not turn based.

title.label: A real game for real gamers.

content.label:
Not for tap tap tards. This game is fun, creative, and visually stimulating. The areas  to be explored are just wicked cool. Having 7 party members gives a lot of flexibility for main character specialization. 

Biggest assets:

Stimulating, but not impossible, puzzles. Starts off easy and progresses to challenging. The game has a really great progression which includes both puzzle difficulty and battle strategy. 

Varied AI strategies (monsters have unique battle tactics) This makes for fun, engaging, fights. 

Beautiful zones to explore. I cannot brag enough about the scenery. GREAT job for a mobile RPG. 

Suggestions for improvements:

When enemies are far away, automatically engaging in tbt combat mode can be slightly annoying, because the monsters sometimes don't even come to fight. This consumes a lot of time waiting for each monster's moving turn.

Even though the player has a lot of options for play-through, the difficulty of monsters and puzzles in each dungeon unfortunately dictates a *mostly* linear play order. This is acceptable. However, the player should be better instructed of this play order. For instance, the ship is intuitively the second place to explore after the crypt but the number and level of monsters there is far more difficult than the swamp. 

Finally, the amount of available gold seems to be on the low side. Because some areas are left inaccessible after play-through and monsters do not respawn, it feels as if there is not quite enough accessible gold to properly outfit each character. At this point, one character is being used solely to play the looting tune, and I'm not even sure if the difference in acquired gold is significant enough to warrant this monotonous use. I feel this detracts from the dynamic play which is so fresh and exciting in this game. 

Overall, this game is ABSOLUTELY worth every penny. This is a real game. No stupid micro transactions to distract you. Just buy the game and have tons of enjoyable spelunking!

This game can be very slow and can tend to get very difficult fast. It is a great game for the phone! Graphics are amazing and yes, it is slow. But once you progress, the action ramps up quickly. Watch for the puzzles, if your beyond 5th grade, you should do fine.
I like the idea of this game it's fun and all. But I've encountered 2 game breaking glitches in just the crypt. I had to restart so many times. Please fix.

The core mechanic is good if you're into these kind of games. I got bored because the pacing was unbearably slow. I had only learned how to set the walking speed to fast after I got out of the crypt. Afterwards, I committed suicide by releasing an ice golem from its prison. The game is punishing and slow if you didn't already have an interest in these games.

This game has some dastardly puzzles. One thing that's really special about this title is that the developers clearly prioritized making a series of puzzle challenges out of novel mob encounters, with a degree of escalation that always keeps it fresh. The puzzle elements are well-introduced, and the magic-based hint system managed to avoid ruining the atmosphere.

With a setup like this, they still somehow managed to create a system that let's you identify an "angles" for optimizing your party's strengths, to incredible and often necessary effect. Few RPGs manage to yield such a satisfying payoff for your self-directed strategizing.
I am thoroughly impressed with the look, gameplay, and magnitude of this game. It was free when I got it but even if it wasn't, I would have payed money for this. Just wow
Can't play at all because it just crashes. Do not get.

After the crypt the difficulty curve is more like a cliff.  Every monster can and will destroy your party.  There is no care taken with progress, and very little utility in the save function to allow you to go back a little without having to constantly micro manage saving.  The graphics are good, but the whole setup is just absurdly punishing and therefore totally disengaging. I would rate zero stars if I could.
Not free but worth the money - I would pay twice what they are asking for this game. It's that fun!

I've only played down to level 2 so far, but I loved this game so much that I felt compelled to leave a review! I grew up in turn based grid RPGs like this (primarily the Wizardry series), so I've got a HUGE soft spot for this particular genre. 7 Mages is an excellent upgrade to the games of my youth, and I can't wait to delve further into it. I especially love how they implemented music into the game too. This aspect really harkened back to the Wizardy series and their bard class. Ok, well that's enough for now. I want to get back into the dungeon!
Really enjoying this game.  Great RPG/dungeon crawler in the vein of the old Wizardry classics.  Fair business model with a full game unlock iap.   Great work!

title.label: Love the tactical gameplay and purchase model

content.label:
What an amazing game! Great tactical fighting and I love the thought put into the puzzles!

I usually purchase premium games and sometimes get frustrated that I paid money for a terrible game. This title offered a lot of gameplay for free prior to purchase. I wish more games did this.

title.label: Very cool, nostalgic and modern at the same time!

content.label: Great game!  Well done.  Has all of the great elements of a wonderful dungeon crawler that give a major shout out to the Wizardry series.  Try for free then pay once and play the whole game: just the way it should be.   Do yourself a favor and pick this up.  I'm glad I did.

title.label: It's like legend of grimlock for your phone!

content.label: If you like grid based dungeon crawlers, you've come to the right place. Very old school, no hand holding.  Free to start and pay to unlock the rest of the game if you're enjoying it.
